subject: Art & Design
title: The Peak-End Rule: How Experiences Are Remembered
description: One-minute skill: The Peak-End Rule: How Experiences Are Remembered.

hook.text: A painful medical procedure with a gentle ending is remembered as less painful than a shorter one with a harsh ending.

buildup.text: The peak-end rule: people judge experiences based on the most intense moment (peak) and the final moment (end).

twist.text: IKEA's journey is frustrating: crowds, assembly instructions, heavy boxes. But the exit has cheap hot dogs.

punchline.text: Design two moments perfectly: the peak and the ending.

quiz.question: What does the peak-end rule say about how people remember experiences?
options: People judge by the most intense moment and the final moment, not the total experience
People remember the beginning most clearly
Duration is the most important factor in experience quality
